intro: Rhamphicarpa capensis, commonly known as the Cape rhamphicarpa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has adapted to arid conditions, making it resilient to drought. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
